review_title: The only non-dairy milk for our family
comments.reviewdate: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2020
comments.reviewdata: Ripple is the only non-dairy milk my family likes.  The mouthfeel is key; it is more like cow's milk than anything out there. And, it has the same amount of protein and even more calcium.  It's great in cereal, coffee, tea, and dessert cocktails that usually call for cream.  I've even used it in pudding and mashed potatoes, as well as macaroni and cheese. The only time I find it gritty is when I haven't shaken it enough.  Although the Original - Unsweetened is my favorite, I stock up on these shelf-stable cartons for travel.  I do wish they would offer the unsweetened variety in these cartons, since we try to limit sugar.  But especially now, when we are trying to limit food shopping to once a month, these have been lifesavers.  As much as I appreciate these 8 ounce cartons when we travel, during this time of plague and pestilence, they're practically keeping us alive (please feel free to chuckle).  Thank you Ripple! Read more

review_title: Easily the best milk alternative I've ever had
comments.reviewdate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2019
comments.reviewdata: I am a dyed in the wool whole milk drinker. I've tried almond milk and soy milk from all of the most common grocery store brands and was never turned off from milk alternatives outright but none were ever good enough to get me to switch. Oatmilk--not just this chocolate variety--is good enough to get me to switch. Full stop. Where other milk alternatives taste and feel thin or hollow, oat milk is round, robust, and thick in just the right way that it achieves that milky quality. This chocolate oat milk went into a bowl of some Frosted Flakes and it was a revelation. Also, oat milk is just as healthy as other milk alternatives without all of the environmental damage, I'm looking at you, almond milk and your disproportionate use of freshwater. Read more

review_title: Contains no Guar gum. Delicious coffee creamer...just mix well!!!
comments.reviewdate: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2021
comments.reviewdata: I usually buy the cans but this was a better deal. I shook the contents before opening but there was still separation of the cream & milk...which is absolutely normal and a sign of a good product. However I wanted the contents mixed into a single creamy smooth consistency that I could pour out into my coffee.  I realized if you shake before opening, there‚Äôs no room inside the container to do this properly. Simply open, pour out a small amour into another container...put the cap back on & shake well.  I have used this with yellow curry paste to make a thai curry & as a creamer for my coffee. It is delicious. I purchased this in March 2021. The expire date in Dec 2021. I purchased this brand & the organic 365 by Whole Foods Market brand. I was definitely happier with this product better! I read you should always read the ingredient list & purchase the coconut milk with the least amount of ingredients. All the other brands in a can (including thai kitchen) have guar gum which is a stabilizer/thickener. This one does not have guar gum. The ingredients are water & coconut. That sold me! I am definitely happy with this purchase & buying more. Read more

review_title: The Best Coconut Milk I've Tried! Buy It!
comments.reviewdate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2020
comments.reviewdata: This is literally the tastiest, creamiest, and healthiest coconut milk I've tried. I had resorted to making my own coconut milk for the longest time because I'm sensitive to the traditional coconut milks sold in stores that have gums added to them and couldn't find any brand of coconut milk that didn't have gums added to their product. But the problem was that although making coconut milk is easy, it's time consuming and the milk spoils pretty fast. I was THRILLED when I heard about Thai Kitchen's Lite Coconut Milk that only has 2 ingredients: water and coconut, and immediately ordered this 6 pack from Amazon. The price for this coconut milk is phenomenal and actually, slightly less than buying them individually at your local supermarket. What wowed me more was the taste. I enjoy having a cup of this each night when I make my Golden Milk. If you haven't heard of Golden Milk, it's an anti-inflammatory drink, chock-full of antioxidants and other health benefits. Making my Golden Milk with Thai Kitchen's lite coconut milk makes the drink extremely creamy and comforting. The recipe is very simple for those who may be interested in trying it: 1 cup Thai Kitchen Lite Coconut Milk 1/2 tsp turmeric with black pepper (or add black pepper separately if your turmeric doesn't have it built in; the black pepper helps your body absorb the turmeric) 1/4 tsp ground cinnamon 1/4 tsp ground ginger 1 tsp pure vanilla extract 1 tsp honey or sweetener of choice Add to a small pot, warm over medium heat, pour, and enjoy! I hope that Thai Kitchen never stops making this coconut milk. I will be a customer for life! Read more

I don't know how they do it. It's nice to get the 6 bottles and once and not to have to store them in the fridge. Super convenient to always have delicious coconut milk at hand. I can always water it down if I need to. But for coffee and smoothies, it's the best. Read more

comments.reviewdate: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2020
comments.reviewdata: According to amazon I have purchased this 18 times.  Occasionally a batch has shown up rancid, but in yesteryears I was able to return/exchange.  At some point in the past year this product became "not eligible for return" so I have dumped way too much coconut milk (and money) down the drain.  (EDIT 2/3/2022: the past four batches of 6 have been varying degrees of rancid) I originally discovered this Thai Kitchen coconut milk [in the box/carton] at Food Lion a few years ago and fell in love.  (I use it in my coffee, for cooking etc.) ..My guess is that warehouse conditions (temperature?) at amazon are causing this to go bad somehow.  I usually like to give everyone multiple chances to redeem/fix their mistake but we're passed three strikes here and Not eligible for return??  I've gone back to Aroy-D coconut milk, it's delicious and more reliable. Read more

comments.reviewdate: Reviewed in Canada on January 26, 2022
comments.reviewdata: UPDATE: After a thorough shaking of a few cans, and refrigerating the contents in a glass bowl overnight, the product had separated once again into chips and water.  Now I find I can't return the remaining 20 (TWENTY) cans, or even one 12 pack of them. A complete waste of my money and time. Please don't buy: you WILL be disappointed!!!! I have ordered this brand before, and have enjoyed it a lot. The flavour and consistency has always been reliable, and top notch quality. So I ordered 24 cans. Unfortunately the product processing is now different, and seems the same  throughout the few cans I have opened so far. As you will know, if you've bought tinned coconut milk previously, the consistency is usually very viscous, and is most often a large blob of cream surrounded by very watery milk. In the summer, you can just shake the can for a while, and the cream/water will combine. In the winter, it takes some warming to get that to happen. The first indication that something was amiss, was that when the can was shaken, it was already very "watery" sounding, even before  warming...... As you can see, the cream is "chips" and they just sit in the water. The flavour is OK, but it's difficult to get the water/chips to recombine into the product into that I've come to expect from Thai Kitchen. Perhaps it's a new manufacturing technique in use, but it's really annoying: It looks as though the product has curdled, even though it tastes quite normal.  I'll be cancelling my subscription for this product. Read more

review_title: Be careful!! Broken seal on some cartons. Got really sick!
comments.reviewdate: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2019
comments.reviewdata: The media could not be loaded. I really love the product, but I‚Äôm only giving it 1 star because I got very sick by drinking from a carton that had a defective seal.  I had the worst food poisoning bout ever. The stomach pain was unreal, nothing like I‚Äôve ever experienced.  I couldn‚Äôt figure out what caused it, but it kept on getting worse as I kept drinking this, thinking that it would soothe my stomach. At one point, the liquid squirted out all over the place when I shook it. I thought that I had not closed the cap tightly enough. Turned out that the seal of the base was broken. So, I had been drinking spoiled almond milk. I inspected other cartons, and I found 2 more defective seals. I‚Äôm attaching a video of the liquid bubbling from the square base of the spout.  I contacted Amazon. It‚Äôs not their fault. It is a manufacturing problem.  They will send me a replacement. I‚Äôll give it another try because I have never had this problem before. I‚Äôd like to think this was an uncommon problem. Read more

comments.reviewdate: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2020
comments.reviewdata: I don‚Äôt know why, but I‚Äôm addicted to Unsweetened Almond Milk! I never realized that I wasn‚Äôt drinking any milk at all, until I started using another brand of unsweetened almond milk. It‚Äôs really convenient to be able to open my front door & have 6 boxes of almond milk there too! Couple of things I‚Äôve done & adore- I‚Äôve started dropping a stick of Cinnamon into a few boxes of my refrigerated almond milk. Yummm üòã I‚Äôm not a big coffee drinker, but have always had a deliciously icy, cold spot in my tummy for Coffee Ice Cream-Only the Best (Of Course) & created an alternative to Coffee Ice Cream! Some may find it to be a pain in their coffee, but I Love It! I start with a tall (10‚Äù tall glass) & fill it halfway w/ Unsweetened Almond Milk. Recently, it‚Äôs been Silk‚Äôs. Then, I literally pour in at least 2 Tablespoons of Medalio D‚ÄôOro‚Äôs Instant Expresso (If I don‚Äôt want the full caffeine tilt throttle bump, I add 1/2 Decaf (Any type you enjoy) & 1/2 Expresso) I add 1-2 teaspoons of ground Cinnamon & stir. If my sweet teeth are jonesing, (sp?) I add Honey or Raw Sugar to taste. Then, to give it that Ice Creamy Luxury Taste, I add either Whole Organic Milk, The Coconut (Canned) Milk & stir like a possessed soul! If I‚Äôm having a bad day or have forgotten to eat & just need some calories, I‚Äôll add a teeny bit of Organic Cream, but of course. Next, once I‚Äôve taken the time to put this all together, I‚Äôll go splay myself somewhere away from my Cell, Laptop & people. Particularly people, as once anyone tastes this, they‚Äôll try finishing mine or ask me to make 1 for them. Somehow, this always seems to happen just after I‚Äôve mixed it perfectly & have just allowed the 1st sip to infuse & begin to completely regenerate my soul, imagination & life-joy! Life‚Äôs gotten so crazy difficult & concurrently simple since COVID dropped onto our planet! Avoiding Iceland of course, brilliant lot of souls in Iceland. Can you even start to imagine how it would feel to See Everyone‚Äôs Entire Face, Everyday-With Zero Fear of Infection? Remember when ... Here‚Äôs hoping that you & your loved ones (2 & 4 legged & in between!) are all safe, healthy & continue to stay so, with a roof over your heads & good food in your bellies. I find it‚Äôs efficient to reuse Cinnamon Sticks, tho I keep the used, washed & dried ones in a separate Spice Bottle then the never used ones. The Sticks do expand in liquids, tho make great straws for Cider, Hot Cider, the warmed version of this Coffee Ice Cream & even in Hot Vanilla (Think Hot Chocolate w/out the Cocoa Powder, a bit of sliced vanilla bean (or vanilla  extract-needs must) & I‚Äôd imagine the Vanilla Almond Milk) w/ Honey laced Cinnamon Sticks-heated, not boiled late at night or after being outside in the cold. With the added benefit of serving with a red-bowed, snazzy Cinnamon Stick Stirrer, like Peppermint Candy Canes!) To reclaim my Cinnamon Sticks, I quickly tired of trying to get them back out of the Almond Milk Box hole, so I slash the topside of the empty container, extract the used Cinnamon Stick, wash it & either dry it or pinch it & put it back into a full container of Almond Milk, headed to the frig. If you enjoy Cinnamon, this is a treat. It‚Äôs a simple pleasure that makes life feel fun & grand for a moment! We Deserve Grand Again, even if just for a moment! Read more

review_title: Lactose intolerant people should love this
comments.reviewdate: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2018
comments.reviewdata: I took a major risk on this product. Growing up, I was lactose intolerant. It turned me against milk. I have been using protein supplements for years and always mixed them in water. People would always say, "Eww, water with a protein shake?" It's not that bad, people. I had noticed that I have been getting worse about snacking on sweet foods. I honestly don't like sweet foods. But I was eating M&Ms, Almond Joy, Mounds, cake and was worried that I was letting myself get too into sweet foods. So, my daughter, who isn't lactose intolerant, loves almond milk. I tried some of hers with one of my protein shakes. I even let the shake sit in the freezer to make kind of a chocolate protein milkshake. It was good! It also didn't hurt me. For those people who try to convince lactose intolerant people of "it won't hurt you", please, understand that we've had hard lives! You all eat your ice cream and we paid triple for some frozen yogurt. We were even scared to eat macaroni and cheese. Milk to a lactose intolerant person is like poison. No offense to Almond Breeze. I have now drank two entire cases of this. I even got creative (bad idea) and tried the coconut almond with my chocolate protein shake, it was okay, but the unsweetened Almond Breeze is perfect in my Naked Nutrition chocolate protein shake. Oh and by the way, keep it away from the teenagers. They have no courtesy. They will drink a whole container and not put another one in the fridge. Probably the best compliment possible was from my son who is 13, he said, "This milk is so good. It's my new favorite because I can drink the whole container." No clue that us parents pay for this stuff. Thinks I've got an almond cow outside. Seriously, really good product, I like the shelf-sustainability. We have a lot of food and drinks and everything else in the fridge, so I can just grab one and get it cold and make my 2 shakes for the day. Read more

I add a touch of stevia and then I avoid the added sugar----no matter what brand to me it tastes better with just a little bit of sweetness added to it. review_title: Great product, price is just robbery!
comments.reviewdate: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2019
comments.reviewdata: This is THE BEST milk alternative on the market, in my opinion, in terms of quality/quantity of ingredients and nutrition quality. That's undeniable. No compromise on taste and the amount of almonds used gives it a delicious, creamy quality that I haven't found in other basic nut milks. And with just almonds and water and not all the fillers of other brands, I know what I'm putting in my body and that goes a long way. Shipping was great, the exp dates are in 2020 so at least 6 months out, packaging was flawless, which I'm all pleased about. The price is the kicker. It was late when I went to make this purchase and for some godforsaken reason I thought this was a 12 pack. I buy the cartons for $5 at my local grocery store and wanted a cheaper alternative so when I did the (incorrect) math and thought I'd be saving 10 bucks, I ordered immediately. Don't order when you're tired! The price feels like some sort of health food extortion... If you don't want to put garbage in your body you better pay the price.... 8 bucks a carton is insanity and I will never purchase this off of Amazon again. Even Walmart sells a 6 pack for $35,so I will be going back to buying a couple cartons a week for ten bucks from my local store and can only be thankful I used a gift card to purchase this outragous and straight-up offensively overpriced milk from Amazon... review_title: The Best Brand Out There, Even Better Than Homemade
comments.reviewdate: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2022
comments.reviewdata: I've made my own cashew milk.  It never came out as creamy as this Elmhurst milk, and you have to strain it, otherwise the texture is grainy.  This cashew milk is of superb quality; it is made with only 2 ingredients (non-GMO cashews and water), and has no added sweeteners or thickeners.  I rely on every single day (that I'm home anyway) for morning smoothies and my bowl of cereal.  It works great in coffee too. Another thing that is nice about this cashew milk is that it can be stored without refrigeration until opened.  I'll buy a case or two at a time and then keep them in my kitchen cabinet until I need to open a new bottle. The company also makes other plant-based milks, most of which I have tried.  The 2nd best one is the walnut milk (also creamy, just a different flavor and more fat content).  I also buy the hazelnut milk every so often (it's a little more watery than these other 2).  Elmhurst also makes almond and oat milk (have not tried the oat milk yet). Yes these Elmhurst milks are pricey and I do go through bottles quickly, but for me this is worth every penny.  I've not found a plant-based milk of this quality anywhere - and I've tried - and it's a lot of trouble to make your own.  It can also be also expensive to make your own if you use good quality nuts, because you need to use a lot to make a milk as creamy as this.  So you can try to make your own and see how the cost and effort compares.  I've tried and think this is worth it and heartily recommend these Elmhurst milks, especially the cashew and walnut milks. Read more

I use mine primarily to pour over my oatmeal (Im also gluten and sugar free). They must have redesigned the cap (as I know some earlier reviewers talked about poor cap design) because I got no leakage. comments.reviewdate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2010
comments.reviewdata: This review is based on more than five years of use.  My family is lactose-intolerant and we eat mostly a vegetarian diet.  We avoid dairy products at all times.  We have tried a lot of substitutes, as we like a milk-like product to use in cereal and coffee and for cooking.  This Rice Dream Vanilla has a wonderful taste and works well with cereal.  It doesn't taste like rice to me.  I love that you can keep extra cartons on the shelf and order it infrequently.  Only the open box needs to be refrigerated, and shelf life is very long.  When I cook with Rice Dream I have to keep in mind that this particular product has some sweetness and a slight vanilla flavor.  That is a plus when I'm baking, and I can actually cut back on the sugar in recipes, but I cannot use it in a savory sauce where I don't want any sweetness.  Otherwise, it cooks well and can be substituted ounce for ounce for milk. Read more

comments.reviewdate: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2021
comments.reviewdata: Specifically Unsweetened Vanilla flavor is the best milk alternative that I've tried!  I actually like it more than milk!  Not that is the same as milk so don't have that expectation.  It's different but definitely share similarities.  It's "thick/creamy" and has a mild flavor so works well with other ingredients, as does milk. Anyway, I highly recommend this as a milk alternative.  Almond milk IME is more watery.  Preferred the taste of almond over cashew.  Oat is OK but too much carbs IIRC.  I avoid soy milk.  But I prefer pea over almond (my choice for awhile now)!  Especially considering Ripple is low carb (unsweetened version), has a good amount of protein too! and also has a much lower water index.  I'm trying my best to be mindful of the products that I purchase and their impact on the environment. Read more

comments.reviewdate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2022
comments.reviewdata: I'm a die-hard dairy person. After a lifetime of loving dairy, and strong coffee every morning with cream or milk, I had to get off of dairy because I developed a sensitivity to it. Never thought I could do it. Then I discovered unsweetened vanilla Ripple several years ago and I am a convert. It tastes delicious in my coffee. It is rich and creamy without added sugar. Plus it has 8 grams of protein just like milk does, so it is nutritious and satisfying. I also use it as a milk substitute for cooking and it works great, in pancakes, mashed potatoes, and anything else I need it for. Read more

comments.reviewdate: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2020
comments.reviewdata: I became aware of Ripple's products about two years ago, and it has become a very positive addition to my everyday life. I am a cereal lover and found that their Ripple unsweetened vanilla-flavored pea milk is delicious, a terrific addition to my daily cereal routine. I love the taste, and it is a healthier alternative to regular daily milk. In addition, it reduces my carbon footprint and uses less sugar.  than dairy or almond milk. Brings eight grams of protein per serving, zero sugar, 50% more calcium than milk, and adds 32MG of DHA Omega 3s. One more element of Ripple is a hugely positive one for me, and that is that their product lasts longer, carrying a "Good By" date that is two to three months long, which is huge for someone who is on the go a lot. Plus, it is cost-effective also. It is so great to be able to order Ripple via Whole Foods and Amazon Prime, as I get it delivered to my home whenever I need a new supply. Read more

comments.reviewdate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2010
comments.reviewdata: I have an allergy to milk products and I am diabetic. For years I have used a variety of unsweetened soy milks. They have gotten better over the years but, are not the greatest. Also, too much soy in the diet really messes with the thyroid. If you have any health issues, your thyroid will get hit even sooner on a heavy soy diet. I had to learn this the hard way. I have tried other milk substitutes: rice, hemp, coconut; all were either too high in sugar, too heavy, didn't work well in cooking or baking, didn't taste good, too expensive or all of the above. This unsweetened Almond milk, chocolate or plain, is delicious! I've used it in lattes, baking, cooking and even drinking it straight and I love it. It's smooth, light tasting and doesn't leave that after-taste that many soy drinks have. I have even given this to people who didn't know it wasn't real milk and they didn't notice the difference. AND, it is very reasonably priced. It fits right in with the soy milks and cow milks as far as price goes. I would strongly recommend this product. NOTE: If you are a full fat milk drinker - this might taste more like 2% or skim milk to you. Read more

comments.reviewdate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2021
comments.reviewdata: We first tried this when it was on sale for $1.  It's so delicious, we've been buying it ever since.  We love non-dairy milks, so we've had soy milk, almond milk, rice milk, and cashew milk; and this oat milk has a creamy flavor and is especially great with savory foods, because it's not too sweet (this "plain" flavor).  However, blended with sugar, this works great in desserts too. This flavor (plain) is vegan too.  (We don't know about the other flavors.) This has become our staple non-dairy milk, because it's versatile enough for both sweet and savory foods. We each have different palates -- one of us can't taste any "oatiness" in this milk.  The other one can taste a faint "oatiness", very subtle, but enough to notice when this is drunk straight with no mixing.  So it'll depend on your individual palate.  If you hate oats even when they're in oatmeal cookies, you may not like this.  Otherwise, it's delicious! Read more

review_title: Not apples to apples; Whole different product
comments.reviewdate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2019
comments.reviewdata: Actually cheaper than the boxed kind, if you do the math right (see below). Amazing product, if you understand what you‚Äôre getting. Typical almond milk, even homemade, is more like a ‚Äútea‚Äù of almonds - in the store it has additives to make it smoother and more shelf stable, and to add calcium etc. This is whole, finely ground almonds, period. The milk therefore has more nutrition - aka calories - per cup. Boxed almond milk has what, 35-50 calories per cup, while Joi has close to 200. We‚Äôve been programmed to think low calories is healthy, but the way I see it is, boxed almond milk is buying a bunch of water and chemicals with a dash of almond. Joi is, again, whole blanched almonds. If you compare the cost per cup, yes Joi seems expensive. But if you water Joi down so it has an equal amount of calories or almond content as the boxed, Joi is far far ***less*** expensive than boxed. A cup of Joi has a lot of beneficial nutrients, while boxed almond milk is mostly filler and homemade usually involves throwing a lot of the almond away after the liquid is extracted. Now that we know fat isn‚Äôt evil (we do, right?), we can see Joi is an actual whole food. Yes you need to keep an eye on the portion size if you‚Äôre concerned about weight gain, but again - it‚Äôs a real food. My housemate makes homemade almond milk which has similar settling, but is much less creamy and flavorful, and more expensive when you consider dollars per nutrient. Also less ecologically sound, as so much of the almond gets thrown away. I was delighted to find this foams as nicely as cow milk in the espresso machine - even delicate micro foam! Not always, I‚Äôm still figuring out why it sometimes doesn‚Äôt. Yes there is a little grit but that happens in homemade too. It doesn‚Äôt happen in boxed not because boxed is innately better, but because boxed is a totally different product. Read more

review_title: Tasty and I like thats it's shelf stable, plus great new packaging.
comments.reviewdate: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2019
comments.reviewdata: I only drink almond milk and I ordered this when I saw it come up browsing the internet one day.  I had never heard of nut base before.  I like the idea that it is only almonds with no fillers or anything else and that is has more of the nutrition and good fats than regular refrigerated almond milk has.  It does separate just like natural nut butters and needs to be stirred before measuring and using it.  I mix it in my ninja blender cup and it works great.  It always mixes smooth with no lumps.  It tastes like almonds and works great in my coffee and smoothies.  The only thing I don't really like is the container that it comes in.  The lid has to be pushed down hard to close it tightly and there always seems to be oil leaking out of the edge.  I do really like this product and will probably purchase it again.  It's not as convenient as refrigerated almond milk, but I do think it's healthier and the fact that the base doesn't need to be refrigerated is great. 8/12  I'm updating my review to 3 stars instead of 4 because I really don't like the container it is in.  I lifted it up after not using it for a week or so and there was a large ring of oil all over where it was sitting and the container was very oily.  I'm hoping it didn't ruin the toaster oven.  This needs a jar with a screw lid to keep all the oil in.  It's a great product, but the container needs rethinking. 10/9 Updating my review back up.  The company reached out to me about the lid issue and sent me a new container with a new screw on lid to try out.  It's perfect and no more leaking.  Plus customer service is excellent.  The only negative that I've seen is the new container is one ounce less than the old one, but I'm assuming this is because of the cost of the new lid and container design and it won't stop me from purchasing it.  Overall I'm very happy with this product. Read more

comments.reviewdate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2019
comments.reviewdata: NEW REVIEW If you don't have the time to soak some gorgeous nuts of your choice overnight in the fridge in imported water from New Zealand, blend them up in the morning, run them through a mesh strainer, and have 1 - 2 gallons of homemade almond milk to live off of for the next week or two, then let's talk about JOI. My last review was hard to write because I wanted to love JOI, and the first encounter with it left me thinking, 'Why is this just a flat, lifeless, diluted glass of chalk water?!' My review was brutally honest that this just wasn't the best way to experience joy. Fast forward to just a few seasons later, and I get a second chance to try the new and improved JOI. Guess what? My first review needs an update! This new JOI is creamier and a great alternative to homemade or store-bought when in a pinch, on a journey, or simply lacking refrigeration. I recommend using a lot of JOI with "better" water to get a more satisfying thickness, adding a dash of salt or vanilla to your taste for flavor improvement, and blending it for a solid 5 minutes to incorporate everything into a smooth finish. Ultimately, this new version is worth trying (especially the cashew), and I am happy to share the news that this might just bring you joy. ---------------------- OLD REVIEW Such a great idea, but somehow failed execution. December 12, 2019 I wanted to like this so much. I love JOI's advertising and the concept of having a nut base on hand to quickly mix with water and go. And, as a branding person, their imagery and expressive nature are to be celebrated. I mean, "Add JOI" and "Made with JOI," how does that not make your heart feel happy? Unfortunately, the flavor is weak, if non-existent. This nut base mix -- though initially appearing like it could be a nut butter who deserves to be nut milk -- is not even relatable to any almond milk you would buy at a store, and it's a whole other galaxy away from making your own at home. The disappointment is palpable. When you mix this into your glass, you won't get the anticipated sweetness of almond, nor the rich, creamy goodness of the oil fats and the proteins swirling unhindered in your cup. No. Instead, you will get a flat, lifeless, diluted glass of chalk water. For the same price, you can soak some gorgeous almonds of your choice overnight in the fridge in imported water from New Zealand, blend them up in the morning, run them through a mesh strainer, and have 1 - 2 gallons of homemade almond milk to live off of for the next week or two. Need some stored away for a rainy day? You can freeze some of your creation as a concentrate. When ready, toss some into a pitcher with water to defrost in the fridge whenever you want. All of this to say, there are better ways to spend your money that will bring you more joy. Read more

comments.reviewdata: Drinking this Blue Diamond Almonds chocolate almond milk doesn't have hardly any taste whatsoever on it's own so that's the downside, However, the reason I give it 5 stars is: 1. According to the label on the box: Serving size 1 cup is only 45 calories, 3.5 g fat (0 saturated fat), 0 cholesterol and only 3 total carbs (0 sugar carbs) so you just can't beat it unless you want to just drink water all day. 2. I drink an EGG chocolate protein shake (only a couple calories and carbs) every morning and this tastes the absolute best mixed with the powder shake. I also add a little Sweetleaf all Natural liquid Sweetener (which is 0 calories and 0 carbs), sweetener is much needed and instantly have a great tasting power drink to keep me full until lunch. 3.This chocolate almond drink is also good blended in the "Bullet" with ice and again must put in the Sweetleaf sweetener and it's very refreshing. Sometimes I add a bannana to it. Yum! I am planning on ordering from Amazon the Sweetleaf chocolate all natural sweetener. I know it will be delicious with this chocolate almond milk too. The "sweetened" chocolate almond milk is to die for but then again, it's full of calories and carbs so for anyone watching their calorie intake or carb intake this is the one to order (as long as you add the Sweetleaf natural sweetener).
